context.rdfs:comment: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.
context.rdfs:label: CreativeWork

properties.rdfs:comment: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."
properties.rdfs:label: accessibilitySummary

properties.rdfs:comment: An alignment to an established educational framework.
properties.rdfs:label: educationalAlignment

properties.rdfs:comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.
properties.rdfs:label: associatedMedia

properties.rdfs:comment: An embedded audio object.
properties.rdfs:label: audio

properties.rdfs:comment: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.
properties.rdfs:label: workExample

properties.rdfs:comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.
properties.rdfs:label: encoding

properties.rdfs:comment: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.
properties.rdfs:label: interactivityType

properties.rdfs:comment: Fictional person connected with a creative work.
properties.rdfs:label: character

properties.rdfs:comment: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.
properties.rdfs:label: sourceOrganization

properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense), is part of.
properties.rdfs:label: isPartOf

properties.rdfs:comment: An embedded video object.
properties.rdfs:label: video

properties.rdfs:comment: A publication event associated with the item.
properties.rdfs:label: publication

properties.rdfs:comment: The textual content of this CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: text

properties.rdfs:comment: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a VideoObject or NewsArticle whose availability or relevance is time-limited, or a ClaimReview fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date.
properties.rdfs:label: expires

properties.rdfs:comment: The publisher of the creative work.
properties.rdfs:label: publisher

properties.rdfs:comment: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.
properties.rdfs:label: releasedEvent

properties.rdfs:comment: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.
properties.rdfs:label: educationalUse

properties.rdfs:comment: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.
properties.rdfs:label: contentLocation

properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as http://schema.org/version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.
properties.rdfs:label: schemaVersion

properties.rdfs:comment: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
properties.rdfs:label: accessibilityFeature

properties.rdfs:comment: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: locationCreated

properties.rdfs:comment: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include:  auditory, tactile, textual, visual.
properties.rdfs:label: accessModeSufficient

properties.rdfs:comment: The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in ISO 8601 time interval format. In the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL. Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".
properties.rdfs:label: temporalCoverage

properties.rdfs:comment: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: accountablePerson

properties.rdfs:comment:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.
properties.rdfs:label: spatialCoverage

properties.rdfs:comment: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: editor

properties.rdfs:comment: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: discussionUrl

properties.rdfs:comment: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: copyrightHolder

properties.rdfs:comment: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
properties.rdfs:label: accessibilityHazard

properties.rdfs:comment: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.
properties.rdfs:label: copyrightYear

properties.rdfs:comment: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.
properties.rdfs:label: recordedAt

properties.rdfs:comment: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.
properties.rdfs:label: commentCount

properties.rdfs:comment: Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.
properties.rdfs:label: fileFormat

properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
properties.rdfs:label: accessibilityAPI

properties.rdfs:comment: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.
properties.rdfs:label: interactionStatistic

properties.rdfs:comment: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.
properties.rdfs:label: contentRating

properties.rdfs:comment: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.
properties.rdfs:label: learningResourceType

properties.rdfs:comment: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.
properties.rdfs:label: accessMode

properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.
properties.rdfs:label: isFamilyFriendly

properties.rdfs:comment: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.
properties.rdfs:label: version

properties.rdfs:comment: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.
properties.rdfs:label: keywords

properties.rdfs:comment: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.
properties.rdfs:label: exampleOfWork

properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: mainEntity

properties.rdfs:comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: encodings

properties.rdfs:comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.
properties.rdfs:label: isBasedOnUrl

properties.rdfs:comment: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.
properties.rdfs:label: alternativeHeadline

properties.rdfs:comment: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.
properties.rdfs:label: timeRequired

properties.rdfs:comment: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.
properties.rdfs:label: thumbnailUrl

properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).
properties.rdfs:label: hasPart

properties.rdfs:comment: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.
properties.rdfs:label: license

properties.rdfs:comment: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
properties.rdfs:label: accessibilityControl

properties.rdfs:comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.
properties.rdfs:label: isBasedOn

properties.rdfs:comment: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).
properties.rdfs:label: producer

properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.
properties.rdfs:label: mentions

properties.rdfs:comment: Date of first broadcast/publication.
properties.rdfs:label: datePublished

properties.rdfs:comment: Headline of the article.
properties.rdfs:label: headline

properties.rdfs:comment: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.
properties.rdfs:label: citation
